raw_data.full_address: 2101 Central Ave, Charlotte, NC 28205, United States

popular_times.title: Usually as busy as it gets
Usually as busy as it gets
Usually as busy as it gets

reviews_data.review_text: Love this place! Resident Culture has great beer, chill vibes, and an awesome atmosphere. Super queer-friendly and welcoming, which makes it feel like a safe space to just relax and enjoy. Major bonus points for being dog-friendly too—my boys loved it as much as I did. We stopped here on the way back to Raleigh, but will definitely be back!

Nice spot to hang out with friends, play games, enjoy good weather. Came Saturday afternoon and spent a couple hours here. I had some wine and we tried the empanada food truck. We pushed two tables together to accommodate our larger party size. It was busy and lively, nice upbeat energy. There are a few pinball machines and some long communal tables inside as well.  I wish they had some fire pits/heaters or something though because it did start to get a bit chilly at the end! I would come back though.
Great place to relax and have a beer.
Great atmosphere and they had nice Christmas music.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for coming to see us and taking the time to share!

reviews_data.review_text: Great brewery! Beer is very good. Had an Italian Pilsner, DIPA, and a lager while here and found everything to be tasty. The space itself has a nice mojo and there’s plenty of parking including an overflow lot. I was told this was the best brewery in Charlotte by a friend, and was not disappointed. I’ve only been to Resident Culture and Birdsong while passing through Charlotte, and while both are quality this gets the top spot.

Exelente lugar con cerveza de muy alta calidad y su Personal es muy amable.
Establecimiento y baños muy limpios.
100 % recomendado.

The service is great from the staff. The selection is fantastic. My problem is I walked up  October 2, 2024 and got nasty looks from patrons. I understand this is in a gentrified area but damn how obvious can you get. Yes I felt judged and uncomfortable.

Resident Culture is amazing! Their beers are delicious, and the people that work there are literally amazing. They helped us out so much when we had to pivot our wedding to Charlotte after the hurricane hit the NC mountains. The events coordinator, Katelyn, did so much set-up to make our celebration amazing, and the bar staff took such good care of us. We will always love Resident Culture!
Incredible BEERS!
Awesome experience great staff courteous service all around enjoyable Brewery.  I love Resident Culture.  Amazing atmosphere
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you, Charles!! We so appreciate the support. It means the world to our team!

reviews_data.review_text: Great brewery and staff! Such a good vibe and a great place to hang out with friends. Lightning Drop IPA is awesome!
More strollers than adults. Okay beer but if I wanted a Chuck E Cheese vibe, I’d go there.
Great beer, tons of fun events!

Highest quality brewery in the greater CLT area. Excellent beers met with excellent service. Specifically: Bartender, Sydney, not only keeps beer glasses full but is eager to entertain w her vast knowledge in television (April Ludgate doppelgänger) & pop culture (superb Shakira impression)… would give 100/5 ⭐️ if possible
Love the beers every time!! Sydney’s service made the experience especially exceptional
Four West Coast ales on tap, that's a record!
Dark, short haired bartender has a bad attitude. She was not patient and was very impolite. Wouldn’t keep her around if I ran the place.

If you're into IPAs, then this is a place you need to visit. The best and freshest stuff in town. They have other beer types as well, but the tap list is heavy on hops. Their wine menu is very good, and I recently tried and loved their slush while taking advantage of the social district on a hot day. The barbecue truck is fine, but I preferred dumpling lady. Food Truck Friday is a fun event they have most weeks.

Soooooo amazing! I absolutely loved the Brazilian Bowl with sausage and a side of fried corn. The seasonings for both were subtle and just perfect! The friendly & helpful service was beyond excellent!

I would give it more stars but the place is usually a day care on the weekends.  I go to breweries to get away from kids & sadly this place is insane with them and it ruins relaxing with a cold one on a summers day.  Charlotte needs more kid-free bars.  If youre looking for a great beer in a gorgeous brewery, but don't mind 60 children running around screaming, this is the spot for you.

Really NICE space especially outside!
Beers are average to a bit above average. BUT $15.50 for 4 TINY little beers (flight) is RIDICULOUS.

Resident culture brewing Company is a fantastic location. The afternoon that we were there all the doors were open, full of families, groups, and couples, and even had a DJ outside. Beer is good staff is super friendly, taproom is clean. If you’re only visiting a few breweries, have a couple hours to kill definitely put this one the top of your list.

I always like the breweries willing to do half pour beers.  An excellent compromise from the tedium of flights (yes, it's a pain to pour and serve them) and having too much beer when sampling a variety of full pints.
As I returned north from South Carolina, it was recommended to me to visit this location of Resident Culture to get the best beer and ambiance the brewery has to offer.  I have no comparison to their other location(s?), but I must say that the experience here did not let me down.
Solid beers, cordial and knowledgeable staff.  A consistent visual aesthetic throughout the building.
One of my favorite breweries in Charlotte with new beer releases every week.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Rick, thank you so much for the kind words. It’s an honor to have the opportunity to serve you and to be on your short list. Means the world to us to see you regularly and for you to take the time to share it here!

reviews_data.review_text: Solid rotating IPAs
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks, Colby! So happy to have you and super glad to hear you enjoyed our IPAs. Hope you got to try our flagship, Lightning Drops! Grateful for you taking the time to share your experience at the place where all the brewing magic happens!

reviews_data.review_text: 7.50 for a half pour and dont accept cash. A lot of other good beer out there
reviews_data.owner_answer:
Hey Patrick, we're sorry to hear about the parts of your experience that were disappointing - we're always on a quest to improve and be better as a team and organization. Grateful for the compliment on our beer!

Even though the menu board has all the pricing listed, was your beertender was able to share that the only half pours at that price are usually the rarest ones with a combo punch of the most expensive adjuncts and usually the highest ABV (hence the half pour servings)? Sometimes the barrel aged stouts have aged for over 2 years before they make it into that beautiful glass. It's a labor of love and one of our lowest margin products, but we can't seem to give up something that just tastes so dang good! We're crossing our fingers that you were able to split tastes with a buddy and grab one of the other fantastic beers on the board!! 

And we're very sorry about the no cash - we wish we could, and understand how frustrating that would be if you didn't know when coming in to see us.  Unfortunately, we decided to move away from any and all cash after we lost a member of our small business community from gun violence during a robbery and we haven't looked back. Hopefully our sharing the reason helps.  We love our people and the pros far outweighed the cons for the safety of our team (and patrons!). 

We always love and appreciate feedback on how we can be better, especially on-site to our managers and team so we can do our best to assist in real time with human connection. Please always let us know how we are doing and if there's anything that doesn't sit right, come share it with us so we can work on fixing it or at the very least, share our why! Cheers and hope to see you soon.

reviews_data.review_text: I did enjoy the beer
reviews_data.owner_answer: Awesome!!  John, thank you so much for coming to see us and taking the time to share. We appreciate you immensely and hope we get to see you soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Lots of beer choices.  Good flights.  Good number of food trucks with varied menus.  Plenty of seating and good service.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks so much for joining us! We appreciate the kind words and look forward to seeing you again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Bartender was super rude!!  Beer is really good, although her cs skills need to be looked at or helped, maybe just fire her. She is doing more harm than good.  Shoulder length dirty blonde hair, rude!!
reviews_data.owner_answer:
Hi Dave, thank you for sharing your experience - we are always looking to expand on how we can provide a better customer service experience and it sounds like we have some work to do. 

Any additional information would be helpful, as it seems your photo shared was not from any of our locations. We would love to know more about how we can better understand what transpired and support our team with training. If you could email us at info@residentculturebrewing.com with how to best reach you, we would so appreciate the opportunity to learn more about how we could have been better.  Warmly, the team at resident Culture.

reviews_data.review_text: The front of house staff member, wish I would’ve gotten her name, was incredibly rude and inconsiderate. She acted like I was bothering her when I asked if I could check out, and then got even more annoyed when I asked her questions about the products I was buying. She then was irritated when I asked about the price because it wasn’t listed. I felt so embarrassed and disrespected, I’ll never be coming back here to give them my business with such unkind and unwelcoming employees. It’s such a shame because I did enjoy this brewery before, but the atmosphere has really gone downhill.
reviews_data.owner_answer:
Hi Lindsey, we appreciate you taking the time to let us know how we are doing. Clearly, we failed you when you came in to visit us and we hope to have the opportunity to make it up to you soon.

We take our feedback seriously and this is definitely an important learning moment for our team to revisit how to create the best and most welcoming experience. When you have a moment, please send us an email to info@residentculturebrewing.com, we would love to do our best to make things right!

Thank you,
The Team at RC

reviews_data.review_text: Bad culture and ignorant employees.
reviews_data.owner_answer:
Hello skyjames k, 

We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us and are always grateful for the opportunity to learn how we can be better. If you could send us an email at info@residentculturebrewing.com, we'd love to hear from you and learn more about your experience so we can work with our team to make sure every guest has a wonderful and welcoming experience. 

Thanks so much,
The RC Team

reviews_data.review_text: Great beer, cool vibes, and dog friendly!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Moose, thank you so much for coming to see us and for taking the time to review us! We can’t say enough how much it means to all of us. Hope to see you soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Some of the best beer prices in clt great spot good selection and amazing service. Cheers! 🍺
reviews_data.owner_answer: Walker, thank you so much for the kind words and for taking the time to come see us and share your experiences! We are grateful to be able to host you in our home!!! Our team is truly the best (and the beer ain't bad either). Cheers to you and come see us again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Top choose for craft beer in Charlotte area. Multiple beer offerings. Lot of seating and food available. Dogs are allowed outside.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Wow, Geoffrey, thank you so much. It's an honor to have been able to serve you and really appreciate you taking the time to come here to share. Hope to see you soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Great spot with a rotating selection of creative brews. Laid back vibe and friendly staff
reviews_data.owner_answer: Timothy, thank you so much! You have no idea how much these kind words mean to our entire team. We appreciate you and your taking the time to share your experiences here. We hope to see you soon!

reviews_data.review_text: I started Home Brewing the day I turned 21 years old in Atlanta GA. Many, Many Moons Ago. So I Know a little something about Beer. I just tried one can of the West Coast I.P.A Collaboration. I Wish I had bought a 6 pack instead of just one can. I Will Be Buying a Six -Pack Tomorrow!!! Hahahahahahahaha 😂!!! Lynn said the best beer in Charlotte, I kind of disagree, I think 🤔 That it Could Be The Best Beer In The World...
reviews_data.owner_answer: Dang, Mark, we shared this with our brew team. You have no idea how much it means to us to hear from you (and Lynn!!). It really means a lot that you would come share your experiences here. Thank you and come see us again soon!!

reviews_data.review_text: Great atmosphere and the bartender was wonderful.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Chris, so glad you had a good time with us. We can't thank you enough for taking the time and energy to share your review with us and let our team know how we are doing. Hope to see you soon!

reviews_data.review_text: One of Charlotte’s best breweries for beer selection & all-around vibes.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Oh Henry, that means so much to our whole team. Thank you for sharing your experience and especially for the thoughtful words. You made our year!! Please come see us again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Klasse Brauerei 👍👍 freundliche Atmosphäre und super Craftbeere empfehlenswert 👍👍🍻🍻💪🤟🤟
reviews_data.owner_answer: Stefan, thank you endlessly for the kind words, recommendation, and taking the time to share how we are doing. We're forever grateful for notes like these - they make everyone's day from the brewhouse to the bar! Please come back to see us soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Great beer. Great atmosphere. Must stop when in Charlotte.
Good variety and spacious inside
I have been here several times and always enjoyed the excellent beer. I am from Slovakia and I recommend everyone to visit this brewery.
Great place to have a casual drink and relax.  The service was awesome!
Love the beer. And staff. Hate the parking and random live music, venue too small for what they bring there
Resident culture? They don't even take cash.

Eh. My favorite thing about this place are the indoor and outdoor spaces. Unique and eclectic - right up my alley and I especially loved the Curio vending machine. The outside is really nice as well with fire pits and a large amount of space/seating.

Maybe it was an off day but the bartender had the personality of a wet mop and I felt like an inconvenience. He didn’t smile; he barely uttered any kind of word - even when I tried to make a joke, you’d think there would be some kind of exchange. Nothing. Definitely got the “order your drink and GTFO” vibe. I thought maybe I was misreading the vibe but my friends agreed they felt the same way. GTFO is exactly what I wanted to do as I did not feel welcome.

I also didn’t love what I got. I got a ginger flavored beer alternative something and it was very sweet like drinking straight up soda.

I don’t go to breweries often but when I do, this place isn’t gonna be on my list. The service and drink left a sour taste in my mouth (literally) and with all the breweries in Charlotte, there are plenty more to choose from.
Great  tap room and great beer.

This place has soo many yummy hazy and sour options.  I'm having a wild Sour Patch Kids Sour that's exactly what you might imagine.  Come on try a beer and get some dumplings from the Dumpling Ladies.
Great local spot with a constant rotating new variety of beers. Easily the best brewery merch/apparel that I've seen in Charlotte too.
Awesome brewery that is spacious with plenty of seating. The food truck festivals they have are a lot of fun. Love the beer names (& the taste)!

Comfortable industrial-styled space with ample patio space serving up what I think is some of the best beer in North Carolina. Often has food trucks on-site and events going on.

Most important aspect of a brewery in my OPINION is the beer itself, and Resident Culture is no slouch in this category. Their biggest focus clearly are the big juice-bomb hazy IPAs which they absolutely crush (see: Lightning series).

Their only weakness is the beer is a little overpriced IMO for North Carolina, but not shocking to see premium prices for premium brew.

Definitely worth a stop for beer lovers.
Paige is AMAZING.

What happened to this place?! Last time here was pre-covid. Everything looked and felt different. I left a bad review and got a hateful message from management. Went tonight and it felt like the very first time I went. Didn't recognize a face behind the bar but they were fast, efficient and professional. Not to mention the environment was super child friendly. Loved it!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hey Daniel, so sorry to hear you had a bad experience with us - please send us a note at info@residentculturebrewing.com - we’d love to learn more. We do our best everyday and certainly have plenty to work on to be better. Looking forward to hearing from you!

reviews_data.review_text: Someone hit my car in the parking lot and then yelled at me and called me a curry head. I told the staff behind the counter to call the police and instead they told me to relax and gave me a beer. They then charged me for it. Might return but wouldn’t Reccomend
reviews_data.owner_answer:
Hi Nikita, everything about what you have shared is concerning. Any information you have about the person you spoke with and the date of the incident would be greatly appreciated, as nothing you have written about should be met with anything except support and immediate action.

If you called the police, they are a few blocks away and should have responded quickly to an incident involving an auto accident and racial slurs.

Since we have two locations, we would also like to confirm where this incident occurred. If you could please email us at info@residentculturebrewing.com at your earliest convenience, we would very much appreciate better understanding what happened in more detail.

reviews_data.review_text: Great food and atmosphere!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you for coming to see us and for taking the time to share your experience!!!

reviews_data.review_text: Nice layout and great beer!

I’m mainly writing this review because I found their ordering and payment system to be cumbersome and annoying. The customer service was nonexistent. You had to do everything yourself  through the app. Someone needs to tell them Covid is over and customer service is cool again! No one would come to the table or even answer a question and there was no one behind the bar. All the employees were hiding in the back and would pop out just long enough to run orders to tables. We scanned the QR code to place our order but there we several screens to get through before we could actually place the order. You go to a bar to socialize not to be stuck behind a screen. Everyone had just come from work and the last thing we wanted was an entirely self serve experience. Counter service would have been better. When the food and beers came out you couldn’t get a word in with the runner. They dropped the food off and ran. We didn’t have utensils and had to get up and get them and water ourselves. Then the ordering app has the audacity to autopopulate tip options of 20%, 25% and 30%. Excuse me? Who am I tipping? There was no hostess and no server and the runners certainly weren’t hanging around to answer a question or bring us a fork. Oh and the system adds extra fees into the tax line item which I find super unethical and then the app charges you a $2 usage fee. So I went to spent time with my family but instead I spent the first 15 minutes getting everyone’s orders in my phone. The beer and food are good but not good enough to put up with this nonsense.
Great space, super friendly staff and the IPAs are world class. They have a really good selection of more drinkable summer beers as well. But I'm sure you already knew all this 😉
Bouncers need to hop off their high horse

I had a good time but I was EXTREMELY off-put by the fact that slices of lime are 10 cent per piece, and then I was made to throw out my ice water...
It was literally in a clear cup, no lid... it was WATER
WE ALL KNOW HOW HOT IT IS THESE DAYS

WHY WOULD I HAVE TO THROW MY WATER OUR WHEN LEAVING A BREWERY?! AM I SUPPOSED TO PASS OUT AND HAVE AN INTOXICATED HEAT STROKE IN THE MIDDLE OF UPTOWN?!

everything was good BUT that

Maybe train your guys at the door to recognize the difference in a plastic water cup and a cocktail glass

Justin at the bar turned my frown upside-down today.
He isn't like all the other lazy kids working in the F&B industry these days. He was kind and professional and should probably get a big raise because that kind of employee is hard to find.
Good atmosphere. Could up their game with hot dogs and warm pretzels with cheese.
Excellent beer, good times!
Love the bar but wish it off we ed more gluten free beers or redbull for customers other than vip.
Good beer and a fun place to hang out. If you like sours, try La Esquina!
This place is great!  Love the vibe and the beer.

From my experience the employees are NOT friendly at all in South End and I was not impressed whatsoever. The one in Plaza Midwood is way better. The beer is reasonably priced and really good! If you’re gonna go to this place I HIGHLY suggest going to the Plaza location!
reviews_data.owner_answer:
Hi Jordan, thank you so much for taking the time to share your experiences and leave a review. We love hearing you’ve had a great time at Plaza and we are always grateful to learn where and how we can be better.

Would you mind sending us an email at info@residentculturebrewing.com so we can set up a call and better understand your experiences at South End? We appreciate the opportunity to better train our team on creating the best warm, welcoming place possible! Cheers and looking forward to our conversation.

reviews_data.review_text:
One of my favorites!!!

I visited a few weeks ago for the first time ever. My husband and I got there first around 5 pm and found a bench to sit at outside. I got a sour beer while my hubs got an IPA. We munched on some tacos and fries (which were delish) until a few more of our friends arrived. After about an hour ish, the remainder of our friends arrives (total 14 people). We were still outside this entire time. It started getting dark and chilly, and I wished they had some lights or outdoor heaters in place but I get it, it's Charlotte so you don't really need heaters at this time of the year. It would have been comfortable though with the heaters. I love love love that this place has beers AND cocktails AND food. I mean that's a killer combo for a "brewery".

I left around 8 pm due to a flight I had to catch, but could very well spend my entire night there. It was such a blast and I can't wait to be back!

Wow. First time comin in here and got ignored by the bartender on her phone. I waited and waited and finally left. I will gladly take my money elsewhere. I heard good things about this place too. Also, the parking is a nightmare here!
reviews_data.owner_answer:
Hi Alicia, thank you for taking the time to let us know how we are doing - clearly, we failed you when you came in to see us and we hope to have the opportunity to make it up to you soon.

We take our feedback seriously (and also, phone use is not allowed while behind the bar) - this is definitely a good learning moment for our team to revisit how to create the best and most welcoming experience. If you can send over an email to info@residentculturebrewing.com, we would love to do our best to make things right!

All Our Best,
The Team at RC

reviews_data.review_text: Fun brewery, good beer, food trucks, kid and dog friendly. Small parking lot but off site over flow parking available. Best to walk or ride share here on busy days.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi, thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience and give helpful tips on how to best enjoy your time here with us! We can’t say enough how much your support means to us. Cheers!

reviews_data.review_text: Great ambiance and staff.  Love that it’s dog friendly.  They always have a great rotation of beers and a good range of options- haven’t had a bad beer yet! Food truck Friday is a busy but fun time to visit for dinner and a drink.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you, Christine! We love having you  and so appreciate the kind words!!! Can’t wait to have you back soon.

reviews_data.review_text: Service top notch servers are very knowledgeable and beer is always great and the tap take over was awesome and Burial tap takeover beer was awesome
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for coming to see us and for the kind words - we loved having you and are very grateful for the support!

reviews_data.review_text: Place is great and the beer is as well. Strongly dislike the QR code ordering process. Multiple problems which never would have happened if I could simply order a couple of beers from one of the server’s delivering orders.

Brandon was an AMAZING Bartender! Try the Aperol Spritzer! Mimosas we just ok. The Parking is an issue and the food counter service sucked, food was just ok.
Spaces are nice and the look is eclectic - still don’t understand the “curtains” of gold beads… Cool bathroom wall treatment!
No samples, no cash, and it's nearly $8 a beer.  Good beer, but there are plenty of spots with good beer in Charlotte.

Excellent beer! And we happened to be there while they were testing a new POS system, which, like anything new, had some hang ups and frustrations, but an overall great experience. We were greeted at our table by JP and he was on his game! Explained the new system, answered every question I had and was literally the best thing outside of the beer about this place. Excellent customer service and amazing beer.

Amazing crew. Some of the best staff at a brewery ever. Some of the best beer Charlotte has to offer period. They are well known for their IPA's. They absolutely crush it. Highly recommend going here. You will have a great time. Prost! 🍻
reviews_data.owner_answer: Dang, Andrew, you really got us with this one. Cutting some onions over here or something! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience Anne for the kind words. It’s folks like you that are the reason we’re here doing what we do! Endlessly appreciative of your support and for coming to see us!

reviews_data.review_text: Great food and service. Will be back for the chicken Bruto. Perfect lunch hang out spot.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Shay, thank you for taking the time to come and see us!!! And for sharing your experience & recommendations. Really appreciate you!

reviews_data.review_text: Beer is great but they overcharged us and said they would fix it but never did. 6 half pours were charged for 6 full beers - ended up paying $17 more than what we ordered. Just check your tab before you check out on their computers. They’ll flip then around with your option of gratuity but not showing your the itemized
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hey Courtney sorry for your experience and for being overcharged. We’d be happy to refund you or give you a gift card for your troubles. It’s certainly never our intention to overcharge anyone. Reach out to us on info@residentculturebrewing.com with your info and we will make it right. Thanks!

reviews_data.review_text: Great atmosphere, always great bartenders, and of course delicious beers. If you're a beer lover in Charlotte, put this on your list
reviews_data.owner_answer: Andrea, we are so grateful for the kind words and recommendation!!! Thank you for coming to see us and for taking the time to share your experience with others!

reviews_data.review_text: Good beer and nice patio. Dog friendly.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you for coming to see us and for going the extra mile to leave us a review. You have no idea how much it means to us! Hope to have you back soon.

reviews_data.review_text: Cool place, good beer, limited parking.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Mike, thank you so much for coming to see us and for taking the time to share! If you’re looking for additional parking, we have an overflow lot a half block away on Central, street parking on Landis & Westover, and Veteran’s Park across the way is a beautiful park with a lot of parking if you check it out before/after coming to see us! (Has the crosswalk to get across Central)

reviews_data.review_text: Awesome place. Great people
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for the support and for going out of your way to leave us a review!!

reviews_data.review_text: If you like sour flavored beer must try 🐿️ friend . Squirrel
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you, Bella!!! Squirrel Friends is one of our favorite sours, so glad you enjoyed and thank you for sharing. We’re very grateful for the support and the kind words!

reviews_data.review_text: Highest quality beer in CLT
reviews_data.owner_answer: Wow, Jess, thank you so much for the kind words, you have no idea how much that means to us!

reviews_data.review_text:
This place has no respect for residential surroundings. Playing loud music at 12:40am. No one up there would answer the phone.
This place hires people who are probably saying they aren't doing anything wrong. They are making people happy serving up alcohol for the whole family. Making a night club outside even though there is an inside. Anyone who complains is probably a miserable person and just trying to ruin peoples day.
They literally do no use the inside. Parking lot is just an extension of the inside and the parking lot is surrounding areas and streets. All so they can make there club scene for outside to attract more people.
So why can't they just play the music loud indoors?
Why do you have to ruin outdoor peace? Then in the late hours.
Didn't your parents teach you anything about respect, boundaries, courtesy?
This place has shown zero respect in the time I've lived here that they give any thought or care about neighbors. Its a constant house party with no end.
Parents with young children and newborns are now starting to talk. Its getting ridiculous!
People who live in apartments who have common sense, at least know to cut the music down at cut off hours of the night. A courteous neighbor just would blast music in the first place.
reviews_data.owner_answer:
Hi Mike, thank you so much for taking the time to share your concerns. If you have any issues in the future, you can always reach out to us at info@residentculturebrewing.com.

We were surprised by your review, especially since even on Fridays and Saturdays, we close at 11pm and our team locks up well before 12am, even on our latest nights.

We looked into it and confirmed that the third party cleaning crew came in and turned on the music to help them get through their work evening. They did not know how to work our sound system, so it played outside and inside that evening. For obvious reasons, the cleaning crew does not have access to our phones - we understand how frustrating that must have been for you that night and are so sorry for the inconvenience. Immediately after your note, we were able to rectify the situation with them and they no longer use our sound system while they work. We hope you’ll forgive us for the disturbance that evening.

We can speak to our team’s professionalism and we have an incredible team of Managers who we deeply entrust. We are a business composed of neighbors to this establishment and many of us have young children and infants of our own. We hope to see you soon and if you do have any concerns, we would love to hear from you at the e-mail address above. Looking forward to it and best wishes to you and your family!

reviews_data.review_text: Good beer. Nice brewery. Crowded parking lot though.
Great brewery! Nice atmosphere! Nice selection of food trucks on Friday night. Large selection of beers/seltzers. Great tasting beer!
Great beer, great venue!
Cool place, go try a brew
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you, Leon! So appreciate you taking the time to share!

reviews_data.review_text: Must stop brewery location for the NE IPA style enthusiast!🍻As good as it gets for the Queen City
reviews_data.owner_answer: Gregory, wow, you have no idea how much this means to us. Thank you for taking the time to share and for the kind words. We appreciate it (and for coming by to see us, always)

reviews_data.review_text: The manager (JP) is amazing and we really enjoyed ourselves on food truck Friday.
reviews_data.owner_answer: So glad you had a great time with us, Shawana!! We loved having you and hope we have the chance to hang with y'all again soon. JP is amazing and we let him know you shared this. Truly means the world to take the time to review and let us know how we're doing.

reviews_data.review_text: very good beer.  wish they had snacks or food.
reviews_data.owner_answer:
Deb, thank you so much for taking the time to share how we can do better. We're very sorry you had a snackless experience with us - we are usually chocked full with Orrman's Cheese & Charcuterie plates, Mere's locally-made Pimento and Queen City Crunch Pretzels, but it sounds like you caught us on a re-stocking day and we hope we have a chance to make it up to you! If you come by again, please let us know and email info@residentculturebrewing.com with your info and this conversation so we can take care of your snack of choice the next time around.

You're always very welcome to bring outside food or receive deliveries here too - since we don't have a kitchen and we want to make sure everyone is fully able to enjoy themselves, regardless of dietary concerns/preferences, we allow any and all outside food options as well. Cheers and hope we get a chance to see you soon!!

reviews_data.review_text: They have a wide variety of beers: stouts, sours, pale ales, IPAs, and ton of collaborations. I like their unique flavors and doing a flight is the way to go. I struggle to find one beer to commit to because of the uniqueness of the flavors and a strong flavor that sometimes wears on the palate. Their food truck Friday is also an awesome outing.
Great beers and a good variety, awesome outdoor seating area.  Staff was friendly and knowledgeable on the beers.
Great spot, great beers, come and you won't be disappointed.  Limited parking in their own lot, uber in because you will want to drink everything on their tap list.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Appreciate you!!! And 100% on the tip - safety first! Cheers and so grateful for you writing a review!

reviews_data.review_text:
One of Charlotte's GEMS
A must visit if in Charlotte
reviews_data.owner_answer: Dang, John, thank you so much!! We hope to see you soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Awesome place. Haven't been in a while, stopped by for a couple drinks and to check out what food truck was there with the lady. Beer selection was smaller than I remember but still an awesome chill spot to go to.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you, Eric!! Honored to be part of date night! We got some new tanks in and moving around all those tanks made for some days we couldn't brew our normal schedule. Appreciate you still sharing that you had a good time and we hope we get a chance to see you soon. Truly, means the world to us, especially after this last year.

reviews_data.review_text: Great beers and awesome staff!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Nick!! You spoil us! Thank you so much - you've made our whole team's day!

reviews_data.review_text: Dog friendly
reviews_data.owner_answer: Yes, indeed x 1 million!!!

reviews_data.review_text: Always wonderful...
reviews_data.owner_answer: Todd, thank you so much!! We're out here doing our best and we can't tell you how much it means to our team to hear from you!! Hope to see you soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Great beers and atmosphere!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks, Jacob! Means so much to us that you enjoyed your time here and took a moment to share. Cheers to you and hope to see you soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Love their hazy IPAs and chill atmosphere. Also very dog friendly!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Dang, Josh, thank you for saying so - we love pups and we are so grateful for your coming to hang with us. Cheers!

reviews_data.review_text: Really nice space and all the beers I tried were excellent.  I had a kolsch, pilsner and a west coast style IPA.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Oh, so glad you got a taste of the Kolsch collab with Casita before it was gone!! Really appreciate the support and the kind words. Cheers!

reviews_data.review_text: Great atmosphere and top notch beer. The staff was great.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Tony, thank you so much for your support and for taking the time to share your experience here. We're grateful to have you and hope to see you soon! Cheers!

reviews_data.review_text: Some of the best beer in Charlotte, especially if you like hazy IPAs and thick stouts! Couldn't recommend these guys enough.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Dang, thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience and for coming out to support us during such a strange year. We really appreciate you and your kind words. Come back and see us soon!

reviews_data.review_text: A top 5 brewery in Charlotte, without a doubt. Awesome atmosphere, amazing beers, and great staff. I've been coming to this brewey since they opened and they've gotten better and better, even though they started out great!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Wow, Ryan, thank you so much for taking the time to come see us and to write a note. It means the world to us to have the opportunity to have been here for the last 3.5 years, especially this last one. Cheers to you and hope we get to have some beers with you soon.

reviews_data.review_text: Their mixed ferm beer with local NC peaches was fantastic.  Glad that barrel aged sour program is delivering its bounty.
Great outdoor space, plenty of tables, beer is amazing, and they serve wine, too. The service is extremely friendly.
Quality beer and staff

Great staff. Amazing beer. Give them a try and let the beer and attitude give you a smile on your face. Every single one of them are a delight (beer and people).

I would have a beer every night here if possible. They all serve you with a smile you can see through the masks.

Food trucks here often that are absolutely great. They taste for good trucks and beer are on point and will not disappoint.
Delicious beer and nice atmosphere.  Great covid 19 precautions in place.  Lots of outdoor seating saved far apart and sanitizing stuff readily available.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Carmen, thank you so much for taking the time to review our protocol and share your experience. You have no idea how much this meant to our team. Hope to have you again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Of all the breweries in charlotte, resident culture has the most beers that I love! Great beer and great vibes.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Wow, Julia, this might have to go up on our wall. Thank you so much for taking the time to share the kind words. We are grateful for you!!

reviews_data.review_text: This is your IPA headquarters when in CLT! Great at all other styles too
Beer here is delicious, good patio with heaters to be outside right now too
Great beer, friendly staff, nice outdoor seating area!
Loved the vibe. And the beer ofcourse

One of the few breweries in CLT that seem to take Covid precautions seriously. Heard an employee nicely remind a guest to put on his mask as he got up from his table without one. Very few places actually enforce masks after you’re inside the establishment. Love resident culture, best NE IPAs in Charlotte!
Always enjoyed this place pre-covid. Post covid they have taken measures to ensure health safety. And of course...beer is good

COVID Phase 3 - By far, the safest place to have a beer in my mind.  Masks on at all times unless at your table.  You get a little plaque that says you're occupying a table so nobody takes it, and when you're done just just flip it over so the staff knows to come clean it.  You can drop in at any table without a dirty table plaque.  No kids allowed at the moment (21+), and they have pathing for getting to the bar and back without getting too close to anyone not in your party.  Everyone was super nice, supportive, and it made me feel super safe.  On top of all this, they have some really great beers.  Very few of their beers have an average rating below 4 on untapped.

They’ve done a great job after reopening. The COVID policies and procedures are straightforward and effective. They have put pavers and artificial turf (replacing the gravel) down on the giant outdoor patio. So glad RC is back!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Glen, we can't thank you enough for your support and the kind words! It means the world to our team to know that you felt safe & welcome coming back to us! Really appreciate you taking the time to give us a review and share.

reviews_data.review_text: Fun brewery in a happening area of Charlotte. They have a wide selection of pilsner's commas ales, IPAs, and tap takeovers from local breweries. Their 🍻 beer is really good and the atmosphere both indoors and outdoors is perfect almost year round. The one drawback is the limited parking on site. They do have a wheelchair ♿ accessible entrance, parking spots, and restrooms as well. They do have some cans and grab and go selection as well.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Jordan, thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience with us. We’re very appreciative of your kind words and support!!

reviews_data.review_text: Tried to go there today and apparently children aren’t allowed. This may be the only brewery in the US that doesn’t allow children
reviews_data.owner_answer:
Hey Brannon, thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience and help us understand how we can do better.

We’re so sorry to disappoint you, we can understand how frustrating it can be to park and unpack with the fam, only to find out we have temporary 21+ rules in place. Many of us have our own children on the team here and very much understand where you’re coming from.

As we navigate this incredibly strange world, we decided with our entire team to operate in our beer garden only and 21+ until further notice. We’ve done our best to share via posts, our website and signage at the brewery, but we completely understand that it still doesn’t change how hard it must have been to arrive with expectations that we were unable to fulfill.

We’re looking forward to welcoming our families back and can’t wait for the day when we’re able to update our rules to go back to normal!

If there’s anything else we can do to have better communicated with you, please send us an email at info@residentculturebrewing.com - we would so appreciate hearing from you!

reviews_data.review_text: Always a great stop in the queen city.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks, Norman! Loved having you and so appreciate you taking the time to share your experience!!

reviews_data.review_text: Best beer in Charlotte! Great people and you must try the Quantum Wobble if they have it while you are there. Their sours are amazing.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Gosh, Arika, enough to make some grown people cry! Appreciate that a lot, from our whole team across the board.

reviews_data.review_text: Awesome place
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you, Joe! So grateful for the review!!

reviews_data.review_text: Good process to manage social distancing and sanitation.  One of the best in the area for NE IPA's.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Wow, Dean, you have no idea how much that means to our team. Thank you for the compliment and for taking the time to share. We’re so thankful for your support!

reviews_data.review_text: I have to take all of my out-of-towners to this brewery. I love it! Interesting and vast beer selection, friendly customer service, and great space.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Wow, Emily, thank you so much!!! There isn’t a higher honor than getting to spend time with you and your friends visiting 🥺 Grateful to get to hang with y’all and for taking the time to share the kind words!

reviews_data.review_text: Cool little place in Uptown charlotte. Just wish they only had more food options instead of snacks.
Solid brewery with good variety of taps and good beer.  Nice staff.  Would definitely return.

Cool brewery in Plaza Midwood. They have beer and wine and there is usually a food truck or two. There is a small parking lot in front and a larger dirt lot for parking a couple blocks down the street. It’s pretty popular for families during the day and they have food truck Friday in the warmer months.
One of the best breweries in Charlotte. The outdoor area is awesome

Food truck Fridays are an absolute must here. The parking lot becomes the best outdoor food court for the food you deserve most at the end of the week. Inside is a large space with live music often filling the room and some pretty wacky, yet delicious beers that are brewed fresh seemingly every day. Always something new here and the staff is quick to help.
Dope dj, dope space
Always a great selection of beers on tap, especially their New England style IPAs. The staff is always friendly. Love this place.
Great Beer and Food Trucks
Great bar service/ recommendations

Picked up this strawberry sour locally in NY. My favorite beer genre at the moment, and this one from Resident Culture is among my favorite examples! Drinks almost like a strawberry cider...the sour is there but not overpowering (wouldn’t be a bad introduction to sours). The strawberry flavor isn’t cloyingly sweet like some cherry sours, more just well balanced. Five stars from me—in my luxury fruit sour category with Allagash Farm to Face and the Imperial Gose from Collective Arts.

Updated - Back again, good selection of IPA's especially the NE IPA's, yes the tiny parking lot out front was full but the lot in down Central on the left was busy but not full. Need to check to see if it's marked better for those who haven't been here before. Beware of flights when choosing high alcohol beers as Resident Culture charges large up-charges.

Some of the best IPA's I've had locally, nice interior and outside seating. Parking is frustrating, very small lot with little to no parking. Overflow lot sign directs you to a old gravel lot down the road that is not marked well, I went by the lot 3 times and only saw signs that looked like I would get towed if I parked there. I finally saw a little sign against an abandoned building saying it was the Resident Culture Overflow lot. I love the beer but the parking experience could be much better!
reviews_data.owner_answer:
Hey Jeff, thank you for your feedback and honesty. So glad you’ve enjoyed our beer, that means a lot to us!!

We can understand your frustration and we’ve been hearing some feedback on clearer signage for the lot, so we made it a priority today and have fixed signage clearly throughout the lot that should be more helpful to someone new in your position in the future - we’re so appreciative of your helping us understand ways to make the experience of coming to see us better and are always looking to improve. Hope we see you back soon. Cheers & Happy Weekend!

reviews_data.review_text: We had a private event at Resident Culture and I cannot recommend them enough! Cassie was so kind, responsive, helpful and professional! Our bartender Haylee was so great, kind and sweet. Everyone involved was so helpful. The barrel room is beautiful, we had 70 people and the space was perfect. It was an overall amazing experience!!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Anna, so appreciative of you taking the time to share your experience!! Cassi and the rest of our team are awesome and we’re so grateful you had a great time with us!! Hope to have y’all come to see us again soon.

reviews_data.review_text: One of the best Charlotte metro breweries! Awesome evolving beer selection with plenty of take home stock to purchase. Hosting other collaborative brews and selection of curated wines and craft sodas and ciders. Plenty of room inside and out with special event rooms. Food trucks on rotation.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Wow, Matt, thank you for taking the time to review us - we’re so grateful for the support! Cheers and Happy Sunday!

reviews_data.review_text: Great beer, big open space for groups.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hey Jason, thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience! So appreciate the kind words and feedback!

reviews_data.review_text:
I had heard really good things about this brewery, but just recently visited for the first time for food truck Friday.

We got there early so we didn't have to deal with long food truck lines. The brewery is really big and the space is nice. There is tons of seating and a nice outdoor patio as well.

My husband was very impressed with the number of IPA options available.

The noise level was also reasonable even when it was crowded which is hard to find these days. We could actually hear each other talk.

They have parking available which is always a plus and during food truck Friday there was even an overflow lot to park in.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hey Jacqueline, thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience. We loved having you and hope you and your husband will come back to see us soon. Cheers and have a great weekend!

reviews_data.review_text:
I have been to this brewery frequently since it is very close to my house. I’ve never been very impressed with their beer or customer service.  The bartenders say very little and are not friendly.  Recently when I went to the brewery with my children and a friend who brought her child, we had the rudest bartender to date.  He acted like it was a inconvenience to have our children their (who are under two and were either in a stroller or being held) If you want to be a brewery bartender in Charlotte, you should probably get use to children!
After giving this place many chances, I think we will stick with Legion Brewing.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hey Jessica, thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! We'd love to know more about how our bartender acted inconvenienced by your sweet babies - many of us in the RC family are parents (mainly of 3 & unders), so it's surprising to hear and we want to learn how to better communicate. Please send us a note to continue the conversation at info@residentculturebrewing.com - we'd love to set up a call or have you come by to discuss further and create a plan to share with our team. Cheers and hope you are having a great week!

reviews_data.review_text:
Great beers in town, these guys really championed the brewery industry. Some weekends the space gets little crowded but the beer overshadows the limited space. I would love to see the expansion of this brewery.
If you are looking for A class beers, don’t miss this place. Great!!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hey Dee, thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience! We love having you and appreciate your patience on the crazy days! Doing our best to make some beer we like to drink and really appreciate hearing it resonate with other folks. Cheers and Happy Labor Day!

reviews_data.review_text: Really good beer and atmosphere.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks, Logan! Really appreciate the kind words and for taking the time to let us know how we're doing! Cheers!

reviews_data.review_text:
Great brewery. I love the beer and atmosphere.

The service was friendly and quick, but left a bad impression when closing out my tab. The bartender deliberately pre-selected the tip amount on the iPad. Boo! I was going to give you more than that!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hey John, thank you so much for the feedback! Please forgive the confusion during check out - we use a POS system that pre-sets a suggested tip, but has a sliding bar to leave a tip for 15 & 20% to make for easy calculation, but there’s also an option there to customize your own tip amount! Our team behind the bar is awesome and totally friendly - if you ever have any questions or issues during service, please don’t hesitate to ask for our manager. We never want you to walk away with any icky feelings if we can help it and want to do our very best!! Cheers!

reviews_data.review_text: Stopped in for my second trip there this past Wednesday on my Birthday. I can't say enough good things about this place. My favorite layout of any brewery I've been to and I've been to tons. The beer continues to get better and the staff was super nice. Hope yall end up doing a mobile canning event in Columbia, SC. I was told yall might be looking for places to do one and Craft and Draft on Devine street would be a perfect location.  Cheers guys.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hey Derek, hope you had a great birthday - it means the world to us that we got the chance to spend it with you!! Appreciate the info on places in Columbia - certainly not too far from us and we're hoping we can get out there more when we have beer to share! Cheers and hope you're having a great week!

reviews_data.review_text: Location was great, tons of seating - outdoor and indoor.  Lots of food trucks.  Cool vib.  Husband had “Whatever you feel just dance it”, hazy IPA and said it was good. I had to pass, full from last brewery. The service @ Resident Culture not so impressive, however. The guy behind the bar was rude and short which put a bit of a damper on our experience - and the reason I only give a 4 star and maybe it should be a 3 because of that... but also realize it could have just been an off day for the guy. We'll try it again.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hey Bridget, we’re so grateful to have you come visit with us and really appreciate taking the time to let us know how we’re doing. Glad you enjoyed the beer and hate that you experienced an off day with one of our team members!! We’ll be working on that and appreciate getting a second chance! Cheers and Happy Weekend!

reviews_data.review_text: Friendly staff, good atmosphere and decent beer. I cannot seem to get served in a timely fashion though, even the times I've been in while it wasn't busy.

Recently held our rehearsal dinner in their event space and had a great time. It's a beautiful, unique venue and I have to say that the beer, cider, and wine were great. Cassi was amazingly helpful and responsive throughout the process. Also, if you're worried about noise bleeding from the bar or from outside into the event space, don't be. Maybe it was just that our group was also loud or the music that we had playing covered it up, but I never noticed a peep from other areas of the brewery. Did I mention the beer was great? Really can't recommend this place enough.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Caleb, we were so honored to be part of your wedding weekend! Thanks for taking the time to hop online and share your experience. We feel very fortunate to have gotten to celebrate with y’all!!

reviews_data.review_text: Band was way too loud and couldn't park since the parking system involves a convoluted scheme of downloading an unknown app. I've moved on.
reviews_data.owner_answer:
Hey Sean, thank you for taking the time to share and give us feedback! We are always looking for ways to do better and appreciate hearing about your experience.

Our overflow parking lot along Central is free, but the neighboring side lot on Landis has recently put up paid parking signage for their tiny stretch of property that is very confusing.

We hate that this happened and are working to put up signage that can better help explain. If you send us an email at info@residentculturebrewing.com we would love the opportunity to continue the conversation and help make things right! Cheers!

reviews_data.review_text:
This is the one brewery in Charlotte that seems to not welcome young kids and families. My two and a half year old daughter and her friend were having a great time in a small corner outside. They were laughing and playing around an empty picnic table. There was a small group of over served females and one male (who also is a bartender at Resident Culture) at the next table over. They obviously didn't care for our two kids. They continuously turned and screamed at them whenever they made a noise. I asked them to stop after the third time. The male bartender left the table to, i assume, let someone know what was going on but he never said anything to me or his friends. The females continued. Then one of the kids fell from the picnic table bench which provoked these girls to LAUGH AT THE CHILD WHO HAD FALLEN. I was blown away. A manager then came out to see what was going on and we explained the situation.  She went on to empathize with these aggressive, drunk and odd women saying maybe they thought the kids were being too loud. Seems like this place is more concerned with over selling beer to rude drunks than the safety and enjoyment of kids who are accompanied by their parents at their brewery.

I was blown away. This place is big and loud to begin with and has a ton of kids running around. For a brewery to side with that rude and aggressive behavior towards innocent kids trying to have fun is unbelievable. I will never be back and none of my friends or family will either.

Do not bring your kids or families here. You won't be respected or seen in the same light as the people who are there looking to have too much to drink and be an unsafe and unwelcoming addition to their customer base.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Ryan, we appreciate you taking the time to give us feedback and are always grateful for the opportunity to learn how we can be better - we’ve connected with one of your friends from your group and hope we are able to get in touch with you as well.  We’d love to learn how to better create a welcoming experience for every patron and would so appreciate your time to hear more. If we’re able to meet you in person or schedule a call to hear about your experience first hand, we’d like to use it as an example to help give our team more tools to handle and prevent the next issue that arises. We’re looking forward to continuing the conversation and hope that you had a beautiful Sunday with your family.

reviews_data.review_text: Great brewery and you can't beat Food Truck Friday.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you, Michael!! Can't tell you enough how much it means to our little brew family to have such awesome feedback and support to share with the team. Hope you have a great weekend!

reviews_data.review_text: Great beers and great entertainment. Plenty of sitting space both inside and outside. There were several food trucks in the area to offer plenty of options to eat. Really enjoyed my time here. The staff was very helpful and friendly and I'll definitely be back!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks, Marcos! So appreciate your taking the time to come join us for the evening and share your experience. Hope to see you soon! Cheers!

reviews_data.review_text: Very good beer, nice atmosphere.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks, Michael! So grateful for you carving out some of your time to share!

reviews_data.review_text: Love their beers! Also, there's usually one beer on tap that theyll donate $1 per draft of the proceeds to a charity, if that's your kinda thing
I had P-Stone pale ale. It’s juicy and enough hop to like it.
Hazy juicy deliciousness
Best brewery in between Richmond and Tampa!
Has a lobster roll and it was delicious also the beer and atmosphere was outstanding!
This beer was fantastic! Im not sure what the name was but it was a 9.1% ABV

Came here for international women’s day event with my wife. Beautifully organized and executed, this is definitely a brewery i will consider going to again. Good selection of beers with a couple sours on tap as well, plenty of open space so it’s hard to be too crowded, and cool vibe with all the oak barrels around. Parking can be a pain as the lot is tiny and the overflow lot is about a quarter-mile walk away.
A diverse but small selection of craft beer, live music often on the weekends, supports the local community including running, bicycling, and kids.
Great atmosphere, great beer!
Great space. Always has a food truck. Games to play
Tasty beers, loved the sours!  And love the artwork.
Good place to grab a beer and see some funky art.
Beer is excellent and well worth the trip.   Parking is a PITA. Enjoy
Open,kid friendly, good beer
Great place! Chill music and awesome beer!
Excellent atmosphere...excellent beer...excellent food truck....
I enjoy the beer and atmosphere here. Once the music was too loud. Pooches are welcome here. The place has a good vibe.
Really nice vibe, bar tenders were super nice, the stouts knocked it out of the park. Lonely universe is among my favorite stouts. Hands down.
Good selection, great atmosphere, and good vibe. I'd come hang out here anytime.

Great event tonight with Discovery Place and Arts+. The space is very open and airy but it was warm and comfortable. You can order pizzas there. They had a food truck outside too. Get there early for parking,  overflow wasn't bad--just a cold walk later.
Loved it. Great beers and nice ambiance. Tin  Kitchen food truck was an added treat!
Best IPAs in Charlotte
Went to a great kids birthday party there; nice spot good beer.
Creepy.
The best hazy ipa's in Charlotte
Good beer awesomeone place! Check this place out!

The atmosphere is great. Plenty of room. They use dry hope for the majority of the beer which is not my thing. Most of the beers are IPAs (as in 85%) which can be a bit much. More expensive than most breweries in town.
Seems pretty good! West coast IPAs are so over so it's crazy refreshing for a brewery to represent other styles so hard. I'd totally go back for sure!
Rad ambiance

We were here for a private party and a couple different beers we're paid for. I sipped on the Lofi Lager all night. Excellent. As far as I can tell they do not serve food, but the joint is awfully big not to serve food.
Atmosphere is very laid back and the oak barrels are a nice touch. Come here to taste incredible local brews; very fun place to bring a date or hang out with friends after work.
Great Beer and Atmosphere!

Was surprised that there was not an Amber lager available. Unspecified craft sodas we're advertised but that was really only one soda with a weird flavor description. Cups were readily available with kegs of water. Only one food truck on the scene which was a bit expensive and not an enticing menu. I was at a similar venue in Durham recently. By comparison Resident Culture Brewing is a half-hearted attempt. All that said, the kids were having a grand time playing and their young parents seemed to be enjoying themselves (though I often question this generation's standards).
Very cool place.
Loved it
Really nice venue and some good beers. Good service.
Didn't want to pay the $10 cover to pay to drink their beer on their anniversary.  Extra strain reputation.

Interesting beers but I did not particularly like any of them. The overflow parking lot was a bit of a walk. The building was cool and the staff was friendly and helpful. I will not return given the other brewery options in Charlotte.
Friday Night Fun Night with Beer, Wine, & Food Trucks

Beer was decent. I'm an IPA guy but the best beer was the Industrial Lipstick Sour. Great setting and neat layout but the music was horrible. Never been to a brewery playing hard core rap. Felt like I was straight up in Compton. Definitely not a family setting like most breweries.
Always a pleasure to hang out with friends at Resident Culture. Plenty of room inside and out. Some of the beers are not to my taste, but I always find one that works.
Ye aaa
Tried to go here Friday 3:20. Gate closed!! Ugh. RC got back to me and explained about Food Trucks. Thanks
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hey David, so sorry to hear that! We have Food Truck Friday every week in our parking lot and have lots of signage up directing folks to the Resident Culture overflow parking lot a half a block away between Landis & Tippah on Central Avenue. Street parking is also available on Landis & Westover and the public lot for Veterans Memorial Park is directly across the street. We hope you'll come back to see us again soon. Cheers!

reviews_data.review_text: Solid IPAs and great atmosphere. Prices are good for what you get.

Beer is ok. Bartenders are rude and they don’t seem to want to help you when it’s your first time and you want some explanations on their beers. Glad they have food truck Friday’s though. That’s the only reason we go.
Great beer, great brewery.  Parking can be challenging, so why not walk, ride, scooter or Uber.

The atmosphere was great, good diversity sorry the picture is dark we were inside the building which was dimly lit, but had good amount of seating. My only suggestion is if u have dogs keep them close not all people are dog livers do mind them jumping on them. I would go again. Parking at the ark across the street wasn't bad, if they plan to keep it going might want to rethink that crossing the street thing for the Customers
Family friendly, good variety of beers at a good price. Frequent food trucks offer a variety of food as well. They also offer board games for free.
Great atmosphere and service!
Great beer, lovely outdoor space.
Nice place good atmosphere. Staff was very hospitable
This was our favorite brewery in Charlotte. They had a great selection of beers with 5 NE IPAs on tap. Awesome atmosphere.

Pretty laid back brewery off central avenue. The facility is very spacious, clean and has a lot of seating inside and outside. They don’t serve their own food, but there’s always a food truck outside which is pretty convenient. Beer is also good as well. They seem to favor IPAs a lot here and unfortunately I’m not a big fan on those beers. They had a good alternative beer there for me so no complaints.
We love walking here for a beer. Typically IPAs but also other rotations. The venue sets it apart
Plenty of good beer and a great space to hang out with friends, coming from the Pacific Northwest, this felt like home
Great place! Big. Looking forward to new beer and revisiting old ones.
Love the vibe of this place. Lots to choose from and tons of parking

RC bolted out of the gate with solid beer straight away. There are many great breweries opening in Charlotte, the good thing is, they each do something slightly different so you can move around depending on what is good at the moment or what mood you are in. Might be a hard sell for friends that don't have a developed palate
Great atmosphere, very good selection of craft beer, and food trucks outside. Both indoor and outdoor seating. Kid and dog friendly. Highly recommended!
Great place. Friendly staff. Lots of space. Dogs welcome. Food trucks! Yes.! :)
Good beer and an interesting variety of food trucks.
First time visiting,  good place. Parking is a bit crowded
Solid beers. Great venue. Very helpful staff.
Great drinks, plenty of parking, dogs allowed on patio (water and treats available!). Overall great atmosphere for a week day hangout spot.
Hip and always interesting beer selections. Good space.
Very nice place to hang out with friends and relax. Really delicious beer and food truck food.
This place quickly became my new favorite taproom in Charlotte. Great beer, great space both indoor & outdoor and always great food trucks available on site.

So, I must say, I do love this atmosphere A LOT. I often choose to come here over other brewery's in the area because the vibe is solid. However, can we pleeeeeeease get something on the menu other than a DIPA?! I know hipsters love them, but after months of only IPA's and maybe one porter (which is average at best), it gets a liiiittle much. Also, whenever I go, they are out of at least 4 beers, leaving 3 or 4 to choose from. And yep, you guessed it... all IPA/DIPA's.

They are still young and getting going, so I'm sure that things will come along  in the selection department. Other than that, I friggin' own at corn hole every time I'm here. Can we get some more boards so that I can keep destroying people?! Thanks!!
Great venue, great beer, and great staff. Can't go wrong here.
Nice place
Great beers and love the scene!
Killer spot and location. Very good Keller pils and DIPA. Super friendly bar staff and all around good people. These guys are going to kill it! Can’t wait to see what the future brings.
Excellent atmosphere and beer!
Nice setting and great outdoor seating area, especially for kids and pets.

I really wanted 4.25 on this. 7 beers on tap. Heavy NE ipa influence. Many beers were exactly the same abv @ 6%, not offensive just left me wondering.  All of the ipa's and one pale were heavy haze with a soft bitterness, good mouthfeel.  If you don't like ipa's I think you'll have a hard time as the only other option was a pils and porter.
Really cool place. Really enjoyed the beer.  Nice outdoor area where kids and dogs can hang out. Spacious inside if it's not great weather out, which is great with the family.
Good beer, great food truck.
Good beer, food trucks, and dog friendly!
Great atmosphere. Phenomenal beer.
Wonderful staff to accommodate our every need. Great International Women's Day event!

This place is awesome!! Yes, it has a tiny parking lot, and it’s crowded. They have a lot of overflow parking not far. Who cares, the beer is awesome and different all the time! Some of these reviews are baffling! Particularly one from a Joe Mug. He calls this place a beer mall and doesn’t like the fact that families are around. The only places this guy liked and reviewed well were Five Guys and Cinnabon. You won’t be disappointed. Don’t listen to Dave S. either, when I’ve been there, which is often, they usually have two IPA’s or a session, and a whole bevy of others.
Really nice environment. Good beers.
Amazing beer, great atmosphere. AMAZING beer.

So far I have tried 4 beers here, and every one of them was good.  I had ipas, pale ales, pilsners, and some fruity thing that tasted like a Sprite/ginger ale....and they were all good.   The atmosphere here is great , would def come here again and again!!
Great beer for a new brewery. Staff is great and the facility is awesome!!
Great space and the beers are above average.
Incredible beer and great space. You'll always be able to try something new when you're there.
Sours, ciders, fruity beers and IPA's aren't really my thing, personally, but I still had fun! I'm told they have a different food truck every night, which is great!
Interesting beer selections, nice space,  good service.
Excellent beer and excellent service!
Great space for hanging with friends. Lots of great beers to choose from. And a very helpful staff! I'll be back.

Ehhhh, the beer is so so. They're just getting started and of course the menu is 78% IPAs because hipsters and frat bros have undeveloped palates so it's what sells.

The robust porter tasted the same as the Amazon home beer kit that I brewed last year.

In about 2 years they will find their stride and hopefully the IPA fad will have died by then. The bartender didn't know what a porter or a stout was, so that should tell you something....

In the meantime if you want solid beer, hit up Wooden Robot or Triple C.
Probably the most potential out of any Charlotte brewery if been too yet. Very nice DIPAs and a clean Berliner.
If you're a fan of the hoppy, the sour and unique beers, this is a solid spot.
